title: Health Economics Overview
section: Key concepts supported by our experts team
text:
Key concepts supported by our experts team

1. Optimizing Opportunity Cost
The value of the best alternative use of resources.


2. Increased Efficiency

Technical efficiency: producing care at lowest cost
Allocative efficiency: allocating resources to maximize population health



3. Equity
How healthcare is distributed across individuals or groups.
Efficiency and equity often conflict.


4. Utility and QALYs
Models relying on quality-adjusted life years (QALYs) combining survival and quality of life.


5. Cost-Effectiveness
Comparing incremental cost per incremental health gain (e.g., ICERs).

title: Methods and Validation
text:
Our reference

Was the question clearly stated and answerable?
Was a comprehensive overview of the competing alternatives presented ?
Was evidence provided to demonstrate the effectiveness of the program or service?
Were the key costs and consequences of each alternative comprehensively identified
Were the costs and consequences quantified precisely in appropriate physical units prior to their valuation?
Was the valuation of costs and consequences conducted in a credible manner ?
Were adjustments made to the costs and consequences to reflect differences in timing?
Was an incremental analysis performed to evaluate the differential costs and consequences between the alternatives?
Was the uncertainty associated with the estimates of costs and consequences clearly identified and appropriately described?
Were all user-relevant concerns adequately addressed in the presentation and discussion of the study‚Äôs findings?

title: About
text:
The HERA Initiative
HERA is your partner that brings transparency and reproducibility to health‚Äëeconomic modeling. It supports you from initiating investment decision in medical programs to submitting your dossier to health Technology Assessment agencies
HERA was founded by expert in health economics. We accompany the different stakeholders of the health sector in order to better understand, evaluated and optimise health ressources.
Our mission: Contribute to a system of health more effective and fair and durable with a approach founded on the data, research in economics of health.
